com.mysql.jdbc

Class ReplicationConnectionProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mysql.jdbc.MultiHostConnectionProxy
      • com.mysql.jdbc.ReplicationConnectionProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PingTarget, java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler

    public class ReplicationConnectionProxy
extends MultiHostConnectionProxy
implements PingTarget
    Connection that opens two connections, one two a replication master, and another to one or more slaves, and decides to use master when the connection is not read-only, and use slave(s) when the connection is read-only.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.mysql.jdbc.MultiHostConnectionProxy

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReplicationConnectionProxy

        private ReplicationConnectionProxy(java.util.List<java.lang.String> masterHostList,
                          java.util.Properties masterProperties,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> slaveHostList,
                          java.util.Properties slaveProperties)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a proxy for java.sql.Connection that routes requests to a load-balanced connection of master servers or a load-balanced connection of slave servers. Each sub-connection is created with its own set of independent properties.
        Parameters:
        masterHostList - The list of hosts to use in the masters connection.
        masterProperties - The properties for the masters connection.
        slaveHostList - The list of hosts to use in the slaves connection.
        slaveProperties - The properties for the slaves connection.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • checkConnectionCapabilityForMethod

        private void checkConnectionCapabilityForMethod(java.lang.reflect.Method method)
                                         throws java.lang.Throwable
        Checks if this connection is in a state capable to invoke the provided method. If the connection is in an inconsistent state, i.e. it has no hosts for both sub-connections, then throw an invalid transaction state exception. Nevertheless, the methods defined in the ReplicationConnection interface will be allowed as they are the only way to leave from an empty hosts lists situation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • doPing

        public void doPing()
            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Pings both l/b connections. Switch to another connection in case of failure.
        Specified by:
        doPing in interface PingTarget
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
